[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/faucet.rs] [Functions: new() + fund()] [Uninitialized Token] If FaucetClient is created without a token and fund() is called on a protected faucet, can the missing authentication cause silent failures or expose the operation to rate limiting? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/faucet.rs] [Function: fund()] [Parameter Duplication] Can attackers duplicate query parameters (e.g., amount=100&amount=999999) at line 88 to exploit parameter parsing ambiguities on the faucet server? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/faucet.rs] [Function: create_account()] [auth_key Confusion] Is auth_key at line 62 properly distinguished from account address, or can confusion between these concepts allow account takeover or unauthorized access? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/faucet.rs] [Function: fund()] [Transaction Failure] If wait_for_signed_transaction at line 104-107 succeeds but the transaction actually failed on-chain, does this create false positive confirmation allowing attackers to exploit? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/faucet.rs] [Function: mint()] [Partial Failure] If create_account() succeeds at line 114 but fund() fails at line 115, is there rollback logic, or can this leave accounts in inconsistent states? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/faucet.rs] [Function: build_and_submit_request()] [Authorization Format] Does the Bearer token format at line 125 match the expected format, or can attackers inject alternative authentication schemes (Basic, Digest) to bypass checks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/faucet.rs] [Function: build_and_submit_request()] [Content-Type Missing] Does the lack of explicit Content-Type header cause the faucet server to misinterpret request body, potentially allowing injection attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/faucet.rs] [Function: create_account()] [Signature Malleability] Can attackers modify the SignedTransaction signature at line 73-74 to create signature malleability attacks that bypass transaction deduplication? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/faucet.rs] [Function: fund()] [Public Key Substitution] Does the client verify that the SignedTransaction at line 101 is actually signed by the faucet's expected public key, preventing malicious transaction substitution? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/faucet.rs] [Function: create_account()] [Signature Format] Can malformed signatures in the BCS-encoded transaction cause deserialization vulnerabilities or bypass signature verification in downstream processing? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-rest-client/src/faucet.rs] [Function: fund()] [Maximum Amount] Does the faucet server enforce maximum funding amounts, or can requesting u64::MAX at line 88 drain the entire faucet balance in a single transaction? (Critical)
